column4: looking for some help with rsync, user@user:~$ rsync -n /home/user/Downloads/ /media/External\ Seagate/
try 'rsync -avn ...' (then remove the -n when you really do it)
by the three periods, do you mean there has to be three spaces
no - three periods was a "continue with the rest of the command" ;-)
so that worked, but the log of all the files to be changed was to long, i cant scroll through them all, any ideas?
go to the /media/External\ Seagate/ directory and do 'ls -la' to make sure everything's there
rsync will report any errors at the end
i only did a test run with -n
yeah, when it returns the list of files to be changed, the list is to long to view in terminal, it wont let me scroll the whole list
add '| less' to the end of the command
it pipes the output into a paging program called "less"
then you can page through the output
is it possible to only copy folders
I don't know - you might try looking at the rsync documentation for options for just folders
